summary: This is a cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated November 9, 2020, transmitting discovery materials to the Metropolitan Detention Center for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center to whom discovery materials are being sent in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the Assistant U.S. Attorney who signed the letter transmitting discovery materials to the detention center for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell, as indicated by the case reference and the transmission of discovery.

events.title: Criminal Case Against Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The ongoing federal criminal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell under case number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) in the Southern District of New York.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
It confirms that as of November 9, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.
The document shows the prosecution (via Audrey Strauss) was actively providing discovery materials to Maxwell in preparation for her defense.
The case is identified as United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
